alert.note: Alert for Atchison; Holt; Nodaway (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 5:52AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Atchison, northern Holt and northwestern Nodaway Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 551 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Craig, or 14 miles north of Falls City, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Tarkio, Mound City, Rock Port, Fairfax, Burlington Junction, Hopkins, Maitland, Skidmore, Craig, Blanchard, Graham, Clearmont, Elmo, Pickering, Big Lake, Westboro, Quitman, Fortescue and Bigelow. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 79 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
